main_definition: Caps is a plural form of 'cap', which usually refers to the brimmed or rolled-edge type of headwear, but also has idiomatic meanings related to achieving high scores or percentages.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A cap, a type of hat with a visor or an indented crown
meanings_and_examples.example: He wore his favorite baseball cap on the field.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reaching 100% in something (a term used mainly in academic and gaming contexts)
meanings_and_examples.example: She got a perfect score of '3 caps' in her math exam, which means she scored full marks on all the questions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A type of achievement badge or trophy awarded for reaching 100% in something (especially used in games and quizzes)
meanings_and_examples.example: John earned a '2 caps' award in his school's science fair, which means he scored full marks on two out of three categories.
